title: A perturbative approach to the macroscopic fluctuation theory
abstract:
In this paper, we study the stationary states of diffusive dynamics driven
out of equilibrium by reservoirs. For a small forcing, the system remains close
to equilibrium and the large deviation functional of the density can be
computed perturbatively by using the macroscopic fluctuation theory. This
applies to general domains in $\mathbb{R}^d$ and diffusive dynamics with
arbitrary transport coefficients. As a consequence, one can analyse the
correlations at the first non trivial order in the forcing and show that, in
general, all the long range correlation functions are not equal to 0, in
contrast to the exactly solvable models previously known.
